meanings.definition: A person or thing that makes something stiff or rigid.
meanings.sent1: The metal stiffeners in the bookshelf kept the shelves from bending.
meanings.sent2: The tailor added stiffeners to the collar of the shirt for a crisp look.
meanings.sent3: The playful kitten thought the stiffeners in the curtains were toys.
meanings.sent4: Her strict rules acted as mental stiffeners, keeping her focused on her goals.
meanings.sent5: The old wooden ship creaked and groaned, missing its sturdy stiffeners.

meanings.definition: A material or device used to reinforce or support something, typically a structure or fabric.
meanings.sent1: The steel beams acted as stiffeners for the bridge, ensuring its stability.
meanings.sent2: The dressmaker sewed stiffeners into the hem of the wedding gown.
meanings.sent3: The chef used pasta as stiffeners to prop up the leaning tower of cookies.
meanings.sent4: His friends were the emotional stiffeners he needed during tough times.
meanings.sent5: The tree roots served as natural stiffeners for the eroding riverbank.
